title: Girl claims she was orally raped by male student at a prestigious private school
text:
A student at the prestigious Geelong Grammar school has alleged she was orally raped by a male student in a study room.

The teenager, 18, reported the alleged incident, which took place in August, to police who said there was not enough evidence to prosecute.

The male student claims the act was consensual, according to 10 daily.

Geelong Grammar School has an expulsion policy for sex acts on campus, however, no one has been expelled over the incident.

The prestigious private school is where British Prime Minister Boris Johnson did work experience on his gap year in the early 1980s.

An 18-year-old student at the prestigious Geelong Grammar school has alleged she was orally raped by a male student in a study room (stock image)

The teenager said she has anxiety and trouble sleeping since the alleged incident.

'I don't feel like the school ultimately took my complaint as seriously as it should have been. The school told me, I had to do things differently such as changing [classes], but did nothing similar for the attacker,' she said.

'I feel treated much differently and to a lesser extent than others in similar situations. Having seen the boy on campus many times since the attack made me feel like my complaint was being ignored.'

The girl's father said he is 'outraged' over the school's handling of the alleged incident and is furious that his daughter has to see her alleged attacker everyday at school.

Upon requesting the alleged perpetrator be expelled for breaching the no sex on campus policy, the girl's father said a school leader told him that the complaint cout result in his daughter's expulsion.

The prestigious private school is where British Prime Minister Boris Johnson did work experience on his gap year

'I said, 'you're going to expel the girl for reporting an [alleged assault] on your campus? Are you really going to do that?',' he told the publication.

He said his daughter is unable to concentrate or study for her VCE exams and is seeing a private psychologist.

In a statement released on Tuesday night Geelong Grammar principal Rebecca Cody confirmed the school 'assisted police with an investigation'.

'The alleged incident ­involved two current senior school students. That investigation has been completed and no charges have been laid. The school's internal processes are still in progress,' Ms Cody said.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Geelong Grammar School for comment.
description: An 18-year-old student at the prestigious Geelong Grammar school has alleged she was orally raped by a male student in a study room in August this year.
authors: Brett Lackey For Daily Mail Australia
